name: CHIJ Our Lady Of Good Counsel
bus: 317 Feeder Bus Service from Serangoon Interchange. 135 , 136 from Ang Mo Kio Interchange.

GeneralInformation.School Vision: Ladies of Grace and Character, Leaders of the Future. We envision our pupils to be  Global Resilient Aware Confident Enterprising
GeneralInformation.School Mission: Together we build a Christ-centred school community for the promotion of truth, justice, freedom and love, nurturing and developing pupils to their full potential with special reference to the needs of the pupils who are disadvantaged in any way.
GeneralInformation.School Philosophy, Culture and Ethos: We are guided by our philosophy that every child is a unique child of God. We believe that every child has dignity and grace and can be taught to be caring and compassionate. We see the potential in every child and we want to develop their potential and talents so that they may grow into confident leaders.   The school's philosophy guides the formulation of all school policies and objectives for our staff development and training. Every OLGC staff respects the uniqueness of every child and is committed to develop the talents of every child to her highest potential. They care for the well-being of each child and uses innovative and creative approaches to create a happy and nurturing learning environment that is inclusive and kind, to foster the joy of learning and inspire passion in children to learn.  We want to develop our children to be successful individuals who are able to serve with compassion and humility and to lead with integrity and perseverance.   The school also works very closely with parents as key partners as we believe in building a collaborative partnership with parents. We believe that education starts from home and continues in school. We see our parents as supportive partners who can play active roles in providing strong support to the school programmes in terms of time and resources. We communicate frequently with all parents to keep them informed of the school's events and programmes, teaching and learning focus and approaches. This allows the seamless transition of education from home to school and from school to home.   Over the years, the hard work and dedication of our staff and the strong support from our key partners have contributed to the success of many outstanding students who are not just academically talented, but more importantly, they have demonstrated themselves to be ladies of grace and character and leaders in their own field.
GeneralInformation.Type of School: Government-aided Sch / Girls' School / Single Session

School Distinctive Programmes.Languages: Drama and Literary Arts for LifE! (Dâ€™LitE)
School Distinctive Programmes.Community Service & Student Leadership: The PROACTIVE Leader in Me Development Programme

SpecialProgrammes.Special Student Development Programmes O: LLP : PROACTIVE Leader in Me Development Programme  The objectives:  - To develop our pupils to be proactive leaders who serve with compassion and humility and lead with integrity and perseverance. - To build leadership capacity of student leaders through purposeful projects and other platforms.   Goals for the Leaders:  An OLGC leader is a PROACTIVE leader who takes:  -Pride in herself, her work and school -Responsibility in building her character -Ownership of her learning and responsibilities -an ACTIVE role to lead her school and serve her community within and beyond school  In OLGC, every child is capable of being a leader and should be developed. As such, OLGC provides various platforms for our girls to hone their leadership skills. There are two tiers of leadership for the OLGC girl, at class level and at school level.   The selection for student leaders at the school level will be done at the end of Primary 3. Pupils will be nominated by their teachers and will go through a selection and interview process before being inaugurated into their roles. Our leaders would have to ensure that they are of exemplary behavior at all times. As such, a review is constantly done to ensure that the pupil who meets the expected behavior continue in the leadership roles.  ALP : D'LitE (Drama and Literary Arts for LifE)  Objectives: - To equip pupils with logical reasoning and critical thinking skills. - To be effective communicators and confident speakers. - To appreciate literature and the performing arts. (drama)  To develop the talents of our pupils, our ALP, D'LitE, develops our girls to be confident and effective communicators and instils a passion for both the English and Mother Tongue languages through various programmes infused into the curriculum. In addition, we also showcase the talents of our pupils by organising biennial musical theatre productions and opportunities to compete in external competitions.
